question: How old is the patient?
contexts: ["The patient is a 76-year-old woman admitted to the hospital for elective hip surgery, open reduction and internal fixation of the left hip, status post hip fracture in , coming again as an inpatient for elective surgery for revision due to nonunion of the fracture.  The patient had the surgery on , without any complications, intraop blood loss of 900.|Pertinent for hypertension; obesity; status post pacemaker for sick sinus syndrome in ; CVA x|, first in , a second in , affecting the left side with minimal permanent deficits; osteoarthritis; GERD, status post intestinal bypass; as well as appendectomy; and cholecystectomy, as well as a hernia repair; depression; fibromyalgia; diabetes mellitus, baseline.|Sulfa with which she gets a rash.|Include atenolol 50 mg qd, perphenazine|7.5 mg po bid, and Tagamet, aspirin.|The patient was not alert and oriented, was not answering questions, or following commands.  Vitals -|7.6, heart rate 92-117, BP 156/70, respiratory rate 16, satting 96% on room air.  In general, she was in no apparent distress.  Oropharynx was clear.  Pupils equally round and reactive to light.  Mucous membranes were dry.  No bruits on neck.  Chest - anterior chest with coarse breath sounds. Cardiology - irregularly, irregular, borderline tachycardic. Abdomen was mildly distended, good bowel sounds, nontender. Extremities - good distal pulses.  Neuro exam - again, not alert and oriented, 1+ reflexes diffusely, good muscle tone, unable to answer questions.|The patient's hematocrit was 28.4, repeat|5.5, white blood cell count not elevated.  Chem-7 141, sodium 4.7, potassium 110, chloride 22, bicarb 26, creatinine|.4.  All three sets of cardiac enzymes were negative.  INR|.3, PT 14, PTT 27.6.  ABG 7.34, carbon dioxide 40, and oxygen 115.  UA was noted to have  white blood cells, with occasional bacteria.  Urine culture showed no growth.  Hip culture on  showed no growth to date.  Chest x-ray had ventricular enlargement and possible early CHF.  EKG had atrial fibrillation.|Most likely secondary to narcotic overuse.  The patient was given 3 tabs po percocet, as well as 2 mg of IV dilaudid.  There was a question of stroke versus subdural versus infection.  CT scan of the head was negative.  The patient remained afebrile.  Urine culture was negative.  Blood culture pending.  Again, the patient responded very well during the hospital course in terms of mental status changes resolved.  The patient, upon dispo, is clear mentally, back to baseline.|Blood pressure has been stable, but because of a rapid ventricular response was given Lopressor pushes, and then finally po atenolol to keep her heart rate within normal limits.  The patient was on telemetry.  The patient was started on anticoagulation of IV heparin, will be D/C on Lovenox and then coumadin 4 mg until she is therapeutic.|Likely secondary to blood loss, given the|00 blood loss.  Stool guaiac negative.  Post-transfusion, her crit has been stable for 24 hours.|She will continue Lovenox anticoagulation, as well as continue physical therapy, going to  Rehab. She has a right subclavian in terms of access which will be D/C.  She was full code, and we were in communications with the daughter.|Included Lovenox 40 mg subcu qd, atenolol 50 mg po qd, perphenazine 37.5 mg po bid, Tylenol|50 mg po q 4-6 h.|  11:07 T:    10:10 JOB#:"]
